info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 4:08PM CDT until June 15 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis TN
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following county, Carroll.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 406 PM CDT, emergency management reported urban flooding in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntingdon, Hollow Rock, Clarksburg, McLemoresville, Hillard, Palmer Shelter, Tate, Leach, Scott Hill, Jumbo, New Zion, Westport, Yuma and Jarrell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING
